LEAD: Kiki Vandeweghe scored 28 points and Clyde Drexler added 20 tonight to lead the Portland Trail Blazers to a 125-107 victory over the Nets.
Kiki Vandeweghe scored 28 points and Clyde Drexler added 20 tonight to lead the Portland Trail Blazers to a 125-107 victory over the Nets.
Vandeweghe scored 20 points in the first half as the Blazers built a 60-47 lead. Portland hit 15 of 18 shots from the field in the third quarter to turn the game into a rout.

Drexler hit all six of his field-goal attempts and scored 14 in the third-quarter outburst as the Trail Blazers built a 99-74 lead. Drexler, who had been 8 for 31 from the field in his previous two games, was 9 for 11 against the Nets.
Caldwell Jones started at power forward for Portland in place of Kenny Carr and finished with a game-high 14 rebounds, 12 of them in the first half. Kevin Duckworth added 15 points for the Blazers.
Orlando Woolridge led New Jersey with 21 points, while Pearl Washington added 18. The Nets lost their fourth in a row and eighth straight on the road.
Their record dropped to 11-32, the second-poorest in the league.
